ratings.comment: Actually the worst professor Ive ever had. Recorded her lectures with a phone camera. Tests took up 80 percent of the grade, and she chose to only grade a few completely random questions off of each test that were different for each person taking the class. Drop policy changed mid semester because class average too high.

She wasn't very good at communicating with her students. The work load isn't too bad given that it's a 5 credit course. I wish she would explain how to do problems better in her lectures. I wouldn't say she's a horrible choice, but I wouldn't recommend taking her class.
A lot of lectures, A lot of homeworks (2-4 a week), group projects almost weekly, tests pretty frequently as well. Honorlock

By far the worst lecturer I have ever seen. Her lectures were slow, dull, and in many cases, riddled with inacurracies. She had absolutely no idea what she was doing for such an elementary level math class. She was completely incapable with the technology and even cancelled our final. I can't imagine a final ever being cancelled due to tech probs.

I took Math 221 with Prof. Meyer during spring 2021 and it was not good at all. There is a bunch of busy work, unorganized material on Canvas, tests that are small in problems but make up for a chunk of your grade, and she doesn't explain things well. I've heard in the past that she is really nice in person, but she doesn't explain her work at all.
Just a terrible professor for Math 171

if you want a professor that does math problems and doesn't explain the steps then go for Prof Meyer. She teaches like she is doing math homework and speaks out loud but does not teach the steps AT ALL. Prepare for weird adjectives used to describe math terms...

Gabi teaches you almost nothing, the TAs are never on track with what she is doing in lectures, and the class was extremely confusing when it should be a relatively basic math class. I wish I would have started using Khan Academy earlier because it has taught me more in the last 2 days than she did in the last 3 months. Avoid her at all costs.

Gabi was not my fave. Her lecture style is somewhat antiquated, and there did not seem to be great communication between her and the TAs. The class wasn't curved when it really should have been, and the lectures were pretty much pointless. I learned mostly by doing the homework.

Gabby is a great person, but when it comes to teaching, she lacks all of the skills to teach her students. She's hard to understand and she goes extremely slow, which you would think would be beneficial but in fact it makes everything harder to follow and extremely boring. Do not take this class if you don't need to.

I took this class in high school and got an A. I only retook to help with engineering progression requirements. Despite knowing all the material beforehand I ended up confused because of her teaching. she switched office hours so often there werent even resources to get help. I honestly dont think she cares about students. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS

Absolutely awful. Went to lecture for first month then realized you arent actually taught you anything. So I learned and stayed home and watched videos and read the textbook. If you take Meyer for 221 just treat it as an online course with 3 tests and 10 quizzes you have to show up for.

She doesn't use slides; she uses graph paper that she writes on that projects onto the screen. And she often forgets to slide the paper up and has to be reminded to do so because we can't see what she's writing. She has no control over the class and is completely unengaged and quiet. Her handwriting is difficult to read at times too.

Today was my last day of lecture and Gabby didnt even bother to finish solving the review questions. Dont even bother taking a class with her, worst professor here. She shows you the question and then the answer without the in-between work. Learned more from khan academy. Assumes youve taken this class before. Tutoring is essential to pass.

Gabbys class was one of the worst teaching experiences I have ever seen. Her lectures are utterly worthless, her TAs have no clue what they are doing, and have no communication with her, and she is impossible to understand in class. Nothing about math221 is inherently difficult, what makes it a weed out class is that there are instructors like her

Gabriele is a very nice lady who cares about her students, but her ability to teach the material is very sub par. I have had to teach myself everything breezed over in lecture. She gives practice problems in lecture, but instead of solving them with the class in a way that explains her answer, she either just solves the problem or leaves us hanging

Gabriele is a very nice lady who cares about the students. However, she is not good at teaching the material. If you haven't taken Calculus in high school, you are better off using Khan Academy in my opinion. That's what I have been doing and I am learning much more about the topics. Don't take her as a Prof if you didn't take calc

I'm currently in lecture bored. Prof. Meyer is a very nice lady. She cares about her 400 person class but doesn't know how to teach. She is definitely qualified to do research, but she should consider staying in research as opposed to teaching. If you don't already know Calc 1 do NOT take this class. You will not learn anything. AVOID THIS CLASS.

Gabi doesn't teach in lecture, but rather speaks broken English and scribbles illegibly on her paper that is projected on the screen. She was helpful if you went to her office hours, but don't bother attending lecture if you're trying to learn Calculus, you'll leave with less brain cells than you entered with.
Gabi gives lots of homework but is a very good professor who really cares about students!
Too much of homeworks which is not worth it and she explains really badly in class

She just does practice problems on a notebook that she projects on a screen, but the notebook is always either out of focus or not in the frame of the camera. She doesn't really explain concepts of the problems or how to do them. Just read the book and do the homework to teach yourself everything.

Lecture wasn't very helpful with Professor Meyer and I feel bad for those who didn't take calc in high school. That being said it's not impossible to do well in the class. She does give a lot of practice problems in lectures, but is kind of bad at gauging the difficulty of the problems so you might be sitting there with no idea how to start.

I am surprised that UW allows her to continue teaching. If you have Gabi and a TA who can't speak English very well, forget it, you'll be learning the material on your own and wondering why you are paying tuition for this class.

I just went to her lectures for the "in-class assignment" and damn: I expected nothing and I was still let down by her teaching performance. Thank god I already knew Calculus I by my own, otherwise I would have had a bad time.

I never knew a professor could be so horrible. Gabi's lectures are PAINFUL to sit through. She pulls up a theorem on her iPad for 2 mins and the rest of the time she makes you do problems that she doesn't even explain. Wish It would have let me give her 0 stars. Cant teach to save her life. Avoid gabriele meyer at all costs.

Yeah dont take this class with Gabi. She teaches off an iPad and just gives practice problems in lecture. She gives you time to work then puts the answer on the screen. She works them out relatively quickly on the board so have fun teaching yourself and struggling to even understand whats going on in lecture.

Gabi is the worst professor I ever had. I always went to lecture but stopped because there was really no point, nothing she said made sense and she couldn't answer questions well. She was nice though. She's the only professor teaching MATH240 next semester and I am dreading taking her again and even considering taking it later solely because of her

I took 221 back in Fall 16 and am retaking it now because I need to refresh before 222, and I can say that the class is SO much better now. The new textbook and curriculum is hard, of course, but is much clearer and easier to understand. I think the majority of people who struggle don't put in the time needed for college classes compared to in HS.

I took Calculus 1 with Gabi and Im not sure how I passed. She is horrible at explaining things, and she teaches class by projecting a notebook onto a screen but never moves the notebook up so you can never see what she writes. She teaches the class expecting that you have taken calculus before. Avoid at all costs.

Pray you have a good TA. I took Calc. in high school, but if I hadn't, I'm not sure how I would have managed in this class. It's tough to read her handwriting, the online schedule was wildly incorrect in large sections, and she struggled to explain the concepts in a way we could understand. Easily my least favorite professor.
Her writing is illegible and I can't hear most of her words. Many of the students have problems after her class because she is not good at teaching and making people understand the concepts.

She does not know how to teach in the slightest. Her resources are harder to understand than her poorly organized lectures. She doesn't know how to explain anything in depth and expects all students to teach themselves. Avoid her classes

Gabi sits for the entire class period with a notebook which she projects onto the board. Her instruction is uninspired and nearly lulls you to sleep. She asks if the class understands material, then re-explains if the majority doesn't. But if you ask a question, she usually just tells you to "think about it," guilting instead of helping.

Gabriele Meyer is the worst professor I've been taught by at UW Madison thus far. Half of the content that she teaches in class never appears on exams, and half of the content on the exams doesn't appear in class; she assumes you've done the extra reading on your own. She also comes to each class horribly unprepared.
